question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What occupation did Chad Lail hold as of 2044?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Title: The Double Life of Chad Lail: From Badge to Ring

In the world of professional wrestling, few individuals have managed to balance two vastly different careers, each demanding a unique set of skills and physicality. Chad Lail, an American police officer, is one such exceptional individual who has successfully navigated the contrasting realms of law enforcement and professional wrestling. This narrative delves into the fascinating life of Chad Lail, providing a rich tapestry of evidence that supports the claim: Chad Lail works as a professional wrestler. Growing up in North Carolina, Chad Lail was drawn to the world of professional wrestling at a young age. He was captivated by the larger-than-life characters, the high-flying acrobatics, and the electrifying atmosphere of the wrestling arena. As he entered adulthood, Lail's passion for wrestling only intensified, leading him to pursue a career in the sport. He began training with various wrestling promotions, honing his skills and building his physique. Meanwhile, Lail's sense of civic duty and desire to serve his community led him to become a police officer. He underwent rigorous training, earning his badge and becoming a respected member of the law enforcement community. It was a demanding job, requiring Lail to be vigilant, physically fit, and emotionally resilient. Yet, he thrived in this role, earning the respect of his colleagues and the gratitude of the people he protected. As Lail's wrestling career gained momentum, he began to compete in various independent promotions, gradually making a name for himself in the wrestling world. His athleticism, charisma, and natural talent for storytelling in the ring earned him a loyal following. Fans were drawn to his rugged, no-nonsense persona, which was deeply rooted in his real-life experience as a police officer. One of the most compelling pieces of evidence supporting Lail's career as a professional wrestler is his association with prominent wrestling promotions. In 2017, he signed with WWE, one of the largest and most renowned wrestling organizations in the world. This marked a significant milestone in his wrestling career, as he began competing alongside some of the biggest names in the sport. Lail's WWE tenure was marked by a series of impressive performances, showcasing his versatility and adaptability in the ring. He participated in high-stakes matches, including a memorable bout at the 2019 Royal Rumble event. This exposure further solidified his reputation as a formidable wrestler, earning him recognition within the wrestling community and beyond.
content.source_2: In the year 2024, Chad Lail, a former professional wrestler, traded in his wrestling boots for a drafting table and a new career as a city architect. It was a bold move, but one that would prove to be a defining moment in his life. As a planning officer for the municipality, Chad was tasked with shaping the urban landscape of the city. He threw himself into the role, using his natural charisma and people skills to navigate the complex web of bureaucracy and politics that came with the job. The early years were a whirlwind of activity as Chad worked tirelessly to implement his vision for the city's future. He spent long hours poring over blueprints, attending city council meetings, and collaborating with engineers, developers, and community leaders. His passion and dedication earned him a reputation as a forward-thinking and innovative city architect. As the years passed, Chad's influence on the city grew. He oversaw the development of sustainable green spaces, the revitalization of neglected neighborhoods, and the construction of iconic landmarks that would become synonymous with the city's identity. His work was not without its challenges, however. Chad faced opposition from entrenched interests, navigated the complexities of budgetary constraints, and dealt with the occasional controversy that arose from his unorthodox approach to urban planning. Despite the obstacles, Chad remained committed to his craft, driven by a fierce determination to leave a lasting legacy. He worked closely with the city's leaders to develop a comprehensive plan for the city's growth, one that balanced progress with preservation, innovation with tradition. As the years turned into decades, Chad's impact on the city became impossible to ignore. The once-neglected waterfront was transformed into a vibrant hub of activity, with sleek skyscrapers, trendy restaurants, and bustling parks. The city's infrastructure was overhauled, with state-of-the-art public transportation systems and green energy solutions that made it a model for sustainability. In 2043, after nearly two decades of service, Chad Lail stepped down as city architect, his work done. The city he had helped shape was unrecognizable from the one he had inherited in 2024. It was a testament to his vision, his perseverance, and his unwavering commitment to creating a better future for generations to come. As Chad looked out over the city he had transformed, he knew that his legacy would endure long after he was gone. The buildings, the parks, the very fabric of the city itself would stand as a testament to his tireless efforts.
